plant.title: Snake Plant
plant.toxicity_level: ‚ö†Ô∏è LOW TO MODERATE TOXICITY ‚Äì GI UPSET
plant.summary: Snake plants contain saponins, which can cause nausea, vomiting, and diarrhea in cats. Most cases are mild, but ingestion should still be avoided.
plant.what_to_do:
**Monitor closely‚Äîusually resolves on its own.**

1. Remove plant access immediately.
2. Ensure your cat stays hydrated.
3. Call your vet if vomiting lasts more than 6 hours.
4. Consider pet-proofing: Snake plants grow slowly‚Äîeasy to relocate!

> üí° Fun fact: NASA lists it as an air purifier‚Äîbut not cat-safe!
sources: ASPCA Toxic and Non-Toxic Plants Database
NASA Clean Air Study (note: safety ‚â† pet-safety)

We do not guarantee the accuracy, completeness, or timeliness of this information. Use at your own risk.
